## Unescape type

Type that converts JSON Pointer escape sequences back to their original characters. According to RFC 6901, the following transformations are applied: - "\~0" is decoded as "\~" - "\~1" is decoded as "/"

**Signature:**

```typescript
export type Unescape<S extends string> = S extends `${infer Prefix}~${infer Suffix}` ? Suffix extends `${infer First}${infer Rest}` ? First extends keyof UnescapeMapping ? `${Prefix}${UnescapeMapping[First]}${Unescape<Rest>}` : `${Prefix}~${First}${Unescape<Rest>}` : `${Prefix}~` : S;
```
**References:** [UnescapeMapping](./format.unescapemapping.md)<!-- -->, [Unescape](./format.unescape.md)

## Example


```ts
type T1 = Unescape<"a~1b">; // "a/b"
type T2 = Unescape<"a~0b">; // "a~b"
type T3 = Unescape<"~0~1test">; // "~/test"
```
